unsolved: How and why people divide (distribute) interfaces
contribution_desc:
A study of how and why people divide user interfaces across devices in private, semi-private, and public environments. The participants want to distribute user interfaces across devices, but they are concerned about privacy and security. They like to distribute user interfaces based on the input and output resources of each device. The participants want to display user interfaces differently on different devices to leverage available devices or due to privacy concerns. The paper discusses implications for design.

Contribution: "cross-device interaction" -> "study" -> "usage patterns (UI distribution)".
deployment: Lab study; Online survey; Paper Prototyping
use_cases_desc: user interface distribution for different tasks - email, calendar, spreadsheet, web browser - in public, semi-public, private environments
device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table); Mounted to wall
evaluation: User study (qualitative); User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment)
